flawed_nl_solution:
Half of Bernie's collection means 18 * 0.5 = <<18*0.5=9>>9 postcards.
So he was able to sell 9 postcards for 9 * 15 = $<<9*15=135>>135.
He decided to spend all of his money on new postcards for $5 each, so he was able to buy 135 / 5 = 72 new postcards.
This means Bernie has 9 + 72 = <<9+72=81>>81 postcards after all.
#### 81

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 27, not 72. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
